extendedIngredients.name: roast beef deli slices
extendedIngredients.original: 8 rare deli roast beef slices (about 1/2 lb.)

title: Beef-and-Arugula Ciabatta Sandwiches
summary: The recipe Beef-and-Arugula Ciabatta Sandwiches could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in roughly 25 minutes. This main course has 345 calories, 17g of protein, and 19g of fat per serving. For $1.81 per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 8. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. If you have arugula, pepper jelly, mayonnaise, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the jelly you could follow this main course with the Pepper Jelly Cornmeal Thumbprint Cookies as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 28%. This score is rather bad. Try Beef Tenderloin Sandwiches with Herb Mayonnaise and Arugula, Toasted Ciabatta with Shrimp, Tarragon and Arugula, and Pepper-Crusted Beef, Bacon, and Arugula Sandwiches with Spicy Mustard for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are my top picks for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Tenuta di Nozzole La Forra Chianti Classico Riserva. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 34 dollars.

productMatches.title: Tenuta di Nozzole La Forra Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description: Crisp, ripe, red berry and cherry aromas are shaped by vibrant, fresh acidity. In the mouth, flavors show classic Sangiovese notes of earth, mushrooms and leather, with a backbone of firm yet elegant tannins.Impressive concentration and depth, with blackberry and red cherry aromas and flavors set in a beautiful Chianti acidity and elegant tannic structure.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400. Whisk together first 2 ingredients.                                                                                                 Place rolls on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 5 minutes or until lightly toasted but still soft. Let cool 10 minutes; split rolls.                                                                                                 Spread cut sides of rolls with mayonnaise mixture. Layer bottom roll halves with beef, folding slices as needed to fit rolls. Top each with cheese, arugula, and remaining roll halves, mayonnaise mixture sides down.

steps.step: Place rolls on a baking sheet.
Bake at 400 for 5 minutes or until lightly toasted but still soft.
Spread cut sides of rolls with mayonnaise mixture.
Layer bottom roll halves with beef, folding slices as needed to fit rolls. Top each with cheese, arugula, and remaining roll halves, mayonnaise mixture sides down.
